rationale: Tests exact MINOR threshold boundary (100% daily absence). Must trigger precisely at threshold to validate rule accuracy.
Tests exact MAJOR threshold boundary (20% monthly absence). Must trigger precisely at threshold.
Tests lower CRITICAL threshold boundary (20% annual). Must trigger at documented threshold.
Tests extreme absenteeism threshold (30% annual). Must trigger at highest severity.
High absence (80%) must trigger CRITICAL. Validates severe absenteeism detection.
Normal attendance (5%) must NOT trigger. Validates rule specificity.
Summer recess absence should be excluded. Likely false positive requiring threshold tuning.
Strategic absence (15%) may mask as acceptable. Potential false negative requiring enhanced detection.
Just below threshold (99% daily) should NOT trigger. Validates precision.
Just below MAJOR threshold (19% monthly) should NOT trigger MAJOR.
Upper MAJOR boundary (49% annual) should remain MAJOR not escalate to CRITICAL.
Zero votes (data quality issue) should handle gracefully without errors.
NULL data should handle gracefully without errors.
Pre-resignation pattern (5% → 30% over 3 months) must trigger CRITICAL. Validates 87% pre-resignation detection accuracy claim.
Election campaign absence should potentially be excluded like recess. Potential false positive.
Extended illness absence (40% over 2 months) should trigger. Distinguishes sustained vs temporary absence.
Minister with 12% absence (dual role) should be acceptable. Validates role context handling.
Consistent 25% absence across all temporal views should trigger CRITICAL at all levels. Validates cross-temporal consistency.
Escalating trend (10% → 25% over 4 months) should trigger increasingly severe alerts. Validates trend detection framework.
Significant deviation from party peers (25% vs 8% avg) should trigger. Validates comparative analysis framework.
Exact 5% rebel threshold should trigger MINOR (salience 10).
Exact 10% rebel threshold should trigger MAJOR (salience 50).
Exact 20% rebel threshold should trigger CRITICAL (salience 100).
High rebel rate (25%) indicates party crisis. Must trigger CRITICAL.
Loyal party member (2% rebel) should NOT trigger. Validates high discipline detection.
Coalition formation rebel votes may be strategic. Potential false positive during negotiation periods.
Principled dissent (12% issue-specific) may mask as disloyalty. Potential false negative requiring context analysis.
Exactly 5 documents (MINOR threshold) should trigger salience 10.
Zero documents (MAJOR threshold) should trigger salience 50.
Average 3 docs/year over 2+ years (CRITICAL threshold) should trigger salience 100.
New politician with zero documents should trigger MAJOR.
Active legislator (20 docs/year) should NOT trigger.
Minister with 3 documents (government work focus) may false positive. Requires role context.
Committee chair with 4 documents (leadership work) may false negative. Leadership quality not measured in document counts.
Combined decline (attendance drop 15% + productivity decline 20%) signals pre-resignation. Validates 87% pre-resignation accuracy claim.
Monthly absence >10% worse than annual baseline indicates worsening performance. Should trigger MAJOR.
Stable performance across metrics should NOT trigger. Validates consistency detection.
Temporary illness absence (recovers next month) should NOT trigger long-term decline. Potential false positive.
Gradual decline over 6 months may stay below monthly threshold. Potential false negative for slow deterioration.
Party with exactly 20% absence rate should trigger MAJOR threshold.
Opposition boycott (35% absence) indicates strategic absence. Should trigger CRITICAL.
Government party with normal attendance (8%) should NOT trigger.
Summer recess absence should be excluded. Potential false positive requiring seasonal handling.
Selective absence (18% targeted) may mask as acceptable. Potential false negative.
Rapid decline (45% → 25% win rate over 3 months) signals coalition stress. Validates 78% coalition stress detection accuracy claim.
Stable party performance should NOT trigger. Validates consistency.
Opposition party win rate drop is structural not behavioral. Potential false positive requiring context.
Gradual decline over 12 months may stay below quarterly threshold. Potential false negative for slow deterioration.
Exactly 5 documents/year (MINOR threshold) should trigger salience 10.
Zero documents in 6 months indicates gridlock. Should trigger CRITICAL.
Active committee (50 docs/year) should NOT trigger.
Specialized committee (8 docs
related_claim: quality over quantity) may false positive. Requires specialization context.

rationale: Committee with 6 documents (just above threshold) masks declining productivity. Potential false negative.
Exactly 10 documents/year (MAJOR threshold) should trigger salience 50.
Zero legislative initiatives in 6 months signals implementation failure. Validates 82% ministry decline prediction accuracy claim.
Productive ministry (100 docs/year) should NOT trigger.
New ministry in first quarter (ramp-up period) may false positive. Requires transition context.
Ministry with 11 documents (just above threshold) masks declining effectiveness. Potential false negative.
Exactly 30% approval for 3 months should trigger MAJOR (salience 60).
Intermittent low approval (2 months then recovery) should NOT trigger. Requires 3 consecutive months.
Sustained low approval (18% for 6 months) indicates marginalization. Should trigger MAJOR.
High approval (65%) should NOT trigger. Validates normal government performance.
Low approval during coalition negotiation may be strategic. Potential false positive requiring context.
31% approval (just above 30% threshold) for 3 months masks ineffectiveness. Consider lowering threshold to 35%?
Declining trend reaching threshold in month 3 (45% → 28%) should trigger.
New party with no historical data (first 3 months). Should first 6 months be excluded?
Significant deviation from average (28% vs 55%) for 4 months should trigger. Validates comparative framework.
Low approval (25%) + high rejection (70%) indicates active but marginalized. More severe than low approval alone?
Should summer recess months be excluded from consecutive month calculation? Tests seasonal handling.
Coalition government party with 27% approval signals severe friction. Consider severity boost for government parties?
Exactly 20% approval on 10 proposals should trigger MINOR (salience 40).
19% approval on 15 proposals (just below 20%) should still trigger MINOR.
Very low approval (8% on 20 proposals) indicates legislative failure. Should trigger MINOR.
Effective politician (75% approval on 25 proposals) should NOT trigger.
Opposition politician (18% approval) has structurally lower rates. Potential false positive requiring context.
Insufficient sample (21% on 9 proposals) should NOT trigger. Requires minimum 10 proposals for significance.
Exactly 20 percentage point decline QoQ should trigger MAJOR (salience 75).
30 percentage point decline QoQ (extreme) should trigger MAJOR (or higher?).
Rapid decline (70% → 35%) indicates coalition friction. Validates 82% ministry decline prediction accuracy claim.
Stable ministry (80% approval) should NOT trigger.
New minister first quarter adjustment may false positive. Requires transition period exclusion.
18 percentage point decline (just below 20% threshold) masks significant decline. Consider lowering threshold?
Z-score exactly +2 (2 std dev above mean) should trigger MAJOR anomaly.
Z-score exactly -2 (2 std dev below mean) should trigger MAJOR anomaly.
Crisis surge (z-score +3.5) indicates emergency legislation. Should trigger MAJOR.
Paralysis (z-score -3) indicates gridlock. Should trigger MAJOR.
Normal volume (within 1 std dev) should NOT trigger.
Pre-recess surge (z-score +2.5) is expected pattern. Should be excluded. Potential false positive.
Gradual decline over 3 months (each day normal) may miss slow deterioration. Potential false negative.
Exactly 60% alignment over 30 days should trigger MAJOR (salience 80).
58% alignment (just below 60%) should trigger MAJOR.
Severe misalignment (35%) signals coalition breakdown. Validates 78% coalition stress detection accuracy claim.
Strong coalition (85% alignment) should NOT trigger.
55% alignment during budget negotiation may be temporary. Potential false positive requiring negotiation context.
Declining from 75% to 62% over 6 months (slow deterioration) stays just above threshold. Potential false negative.
P1 percentile (0.5% absence) - Exceptional attendance should NOT trigger. Validates low-end extreme handling.
P99 percentile (85% absence) - Critical absence crisis should trigger maximum severity. Validates high-end extreme detection.
2014 government crisis (65% absence spike) - Historical extreme should trigger CRITICAL. Validates crisis pattern detection.
2022 election cycle (3% absence) - Pre-election engagement should NOT trigger. Validates election cycle handling.
P1 productivity (1 doc/year) - Critical low productivity should trigger. Validates bottom percentile detection.
P99 productivity (95 docs/year) - Exceptional productivity should NOT trigger violations. Validates high achiever handling.
2018 election deadlock (15% coalition alignment) - Should trigger HIGH_COALITION_STRESS. Validates historical pattern.
P99 coalition stress (55-point alignment drop) - Should trigger HIGH_COALITION_STRESS. Validates extreme stress detection.
P1 coalition stability (94% alignment) - Should indicate STABLE_COALITION. Validates exceptional stability.
P99 multi-dimensional risk (12 violations across 5 dimensions) - Should trigger EXTREME_MULTI_DIMENSION_RISK.
P1 perfect performance (0 violations 85 docs/year) - Should indicate EXEMPLARY_PERFORMANCE.
P99 ministry catastrophic decline (75%→25% approval) - Should trigger CATASTROPHIC_MINISTRY_DECLINE.
P1 ministry recovery (40%→85% approval) - Should indicate EXCEPTIONAL_MINISTRY_RECOVERY.
Q4 pre-election surge (1.85x baseline) - Should be recognized as EXTREME_PRE_ELECTION_SURGE not anomaly.
Q3 summer recess (0.12x baseline) - Should be recognized as TYPICAL_SUMMER_RECESS not crisis.
